channel.title: Age of Ravens: History of Horror RPGs (1981-1990)
channel.description: ![histhorrorbanner|690x226](upload://nIgNVWTXbeDM474xn7Jh1lPXByk.jpeg) I've continued my greatest hits of "Age of Ravens" series with another first installment from my History of RPG Genre posts, along with links to the reset of the series. Today I return to the first list I ever did for these, my look at where horror rpgs started. This one walks all the way up to White Wolf's doorstep. https://www.gauntlet-rpg.com/blog/aor-history-of-horror-rpgs-part-one-1981-1990

item.title: Age of Ravens: History of Horror RPGs (1981-1990)
item.dc:creator: @edige23
item.description:
@edige23 wrote:

Dark Space is strange-- it feels such like a house campaign that got written up because people wanted lots of weird new tables and mechanics.

Read full topic
item.source: Age of Ravens: History of Horror RPGs (1981-1990)

item.title: Age of Ravens: History of Horror RPGs (1981-1990)
item.dc:creator: @BlakeRyan
item.description:
@BlakeRyan wrote:

Wanted to play/run Beyond the Supernatural, but after AD&D 2e my group wanted to crank up the Shadowrun because they went gear mad with all the splatbooks.

Did play Darkspace, it got violent and weird quick turning the proposed campaign into a one shot, but it was more interesting than vanilla Spacemaster.

Read full topic
item.source: Age of Ravens: History of Horror RPGs (1981-1990)

item.title: Age of Ravens: History of Horror RPGs (1981-1990)
item.dc:creator: @edige23
item.description:
@edige23 wrote:

histhorrorbanner906×297 164 KB
I’ve continued my greatest hits of “Age of Ravens” series with another first installment from my History of RPG Genre posts, along with links to the reset of the series. Today I return to the first list I ever did for these, my look at where horror rpgs started. This one walks all the way up to White Wolf’s doorstep.
THE GAUNTLET

AoR: History of Horror RPGs (Part One: 1981-1990)

As I mentioned last post, for the next several weeks I’m revisiting the first installments of each of my Histories of RPG Genres. Horror was the first one I did, spurred by an offhand comment by...

Read full topic
